image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Michigan; born in Detroit, Wayne County, Mich., October 6, 1951; attended, Oakland Community College, Bloomfield Hills, Mich.; attended, Michigan State University, Lansing, Mich.; B.A., St. Mary's College, Orchard Lake, Mich.; M.A., Marygrove College, Detroit, Mich.; United States Army, 1968-1971, 2007-2008; Michigan Army National Guard, 1974, 1990-2009; automotive designer; contractor; teacher; farmer; unsuccessful nominee for election to the Michigan state senate in 2010; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress (January 3, 2013-January 3, 2015); unsuccessful candidate for renomination to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Sixteenth Congress in 2018; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Seventeenth Congress in 2020.
